review:
Je suis bloqué au tuto.
Mais sinon la vie est belle, hein.
Нормик

2016
I was eager for the release of Overwatch, The premise was fun, for me, I saw that as a "modern" TF2, with extra elements. Played through the beta, it was the most fun I had in ages, got the game, and played over 1k hours by then. 

Watching the game grow gradually was a nice experience, though at some point I lost the spark on the game. One fear I always had was from Blizz making this game F2P. 

"But why? TF2 was made F2P at some point and it was great."
Personally, I felt like the reason for why I feared OW going F2P was monetization behind it's side-content, I had worries that with modern "Live Service" games, Overwatch would simply become a big cash grab with its content, and with the normalization of battle passes, it would certainly become yet another grindy experience. 

...It happened, unfortunately. 
Overwatch 2 is just a shadow of what Overwatch was. Nowadays, it's just a generic, cashgrabbing F2P games. New player? Good luck grinding several hours to unlock heroes. Long-time player? Enjoy spending several hours to unlock the newest hero (that is, unless you pay them for the ********* battlepass to ever exist), 

This game isn't worth it, there are better games around, like TF2.

Removed loot boxes which you could earn for free in favor of a Battlepass and if you want one of those old Skins you have to pay for them. For legendary skins anywhere between 10 and 20 bucks. 

Locking Heroes behind a battlepass.

Only reason OW2 exists in the first place was because of the Story Mode, which Blizzard decided to not make and instead you get "Invasion" a watered down story mode so to speak, which at the time of writing are 3 whole missions for 15 bucks.

Do yourself a favor and just play TF2.

Um jogo com personagens carismáticos e incríveis, gameplay boa e divertida, conteúdo novo adicionado, uma fanbase fiel E DISPONIVEL NA STEAM???

SIM!! ELE MESMO, TEAM FORTRESS 2!!

fun game. good for casual fun. i think overall for a f2p experience youll probably have some fun here. it definitely has its rough patches but overall ive enjoyed this game since it came out back in 2016 and ill probably continue to (although i didnt play at all last season). HOWEVER: although i can recommend playing the game if you need a PvP game to play for a little bit maybe with some friends, my overall opinion of overwatch 2 and the direction its going in is negative. we have been burnt a lot and in a major way since the launch of overwatch 2 (not to mention the way overwatch 1 ended/was in its last 2 years of essentially nothing). activision blizzard king is a terrible greedy company. and i mean the company, not the devs. spare the devs please, i dont think this is entirely or even mostly their fault. and while that may not sound like it applies here and like im just hating blizzard, the overall decision making on a corporate level has absolutely affected this game, whether its the live service model, the awful microtransactions, or just a lack of dedicated resources to give overwatch 2 the service it needs (mostly the PvE, yknow, the whole reason for this games existence and the death of overwatch 1). overall the devs are doing an okay job maintaining the game with content, it isnt the worst ive seen, but i think they deserve more staff and money to fully unlock this games potential. it feels as if activision has put overwatch on a backburner to focus more on games like COD, but i think overwatch (at one point, not anymore) could have been way bigger than it was if they were able to deliver more content. also, where are the missions i paid for? t4 seems very passionate and undersupplied, but theres no excuse for the dlc i paid for to not function after i pay for it. im sure itll get fixed but thats ridiculous. and before you say anything, i know. i shouldnt have even entertained the idea of buying this stuff. it was out of nothing but curiosity and i get punished like this. serves me right for giving this company money. this game is just a bunch of broken promises and dreams stitched together by a team trying to make ends meet and i feel terrible for them. i hope one day this game can be done the justice it deserves but if bobby will continue to neglect it while pumping out garbage fire money printers like diablo immortal then we wont see that.

and by the way, as i said, ive owned and technically played this since 2016 (although i stopped for a few years after the game died, yknow, while they were working on this "sequel"). i have seen people say "oh play the game before reviewing it" "oh man all these people just hate blizzard they have 15 minutes on record play the game before joining the hateful mob" i did. most of us did. yknow, its been available for 7 years and all... im just incredibly disappointed at where this game has gone. (and i hate blizzard, but i would give this a good review if i felt the game was heading in a good direction, it isnt)

- progression, free loot 
+ agressive monetization everywhere
+ slaps a 2 on it
Remove the "2" from the game's title

Pros:
- I don't have to use the battle.net launcher to play this game

Cons:
- Everything else

J'ai payé pour le 1 et ils l'ont tué pour sortir un 2 qui devait être "mieux". 

Le gameplay est toujours fun mais en même temps ils se sont servis du cadavre du 1 donc c'était dure de faire un vrai mauvais jeu. Le 1 avait un PVE et le 2 promettait un nouveau PVE, finalement alors que le jeu brasse de l'argent en masse avec son modèle économique, [b]PVE annulé[/b].

 [u]En conclusion[/u]: Le 2 est juste une mise a jour, c'est [b]un bon jeu[/b] malgré ses défauts mais [b]gangrené[/b] par la société avide qui l'a engendré pour de [b]mauvaises raisons[/b]. Le 1 était mieux, vive le 1, mais il est mort et je porte son deuil avec [b]amertume[/b].

[i]Je vous souhaite à tous d'agréables parties sur ce jeu ou n'importe quel autre. [/i]

Great game, great universe, horrendous monetization, disgusting company, awful teammates and monkey devs that cannot balance the characters.

Just play TF2 instead, please. You have literally no reason to play this. TF2 is also free, not to mention the company behind this has a mean streak of sexual harrassment and broken promises. Just please, play TF2 instead, or any other class-based shooter for that matter. Rainbow 6, Apex Legends, L4D, hell even[b] Paladins [/b] is better than this. Don't play this game. I beg of you.

ДПС Мерси имба

Çıkışta PvE yetişmedi diyip PvE modunu ayırdılar ve sonradan satmaya karar verdiler. Oyunu live service oyuna dönüştürüp bok gibi battle pass sistemi eklediler. battle passin worth bir içeriği yok boşa para ve vakit kaybı. Пока все играют в это говно, я расскажу вам рецепт вкусных домашних блинчиков

ИНГРЕДИЕНТЫ:
Молоко 500 мл
Куриное яйцо 2 штуки
Сахар 1 столовая ложка
Растительное масло 2 столовые ложки
Пшеничная мука 200 г
Соль по вкусу
Сода 2 г

ИНСТРУКЦИЯ ПРИГОТОВЛЕНИЯ:
1. Яйца взбить с сахаром и солью.
2. Добавить растительное масло, перемешать.
3. Добавить молоко, хорошо перемешать.
4. Добавить соду и муку, хорошо перемешать венчиком или миксером.
5. Сковороду разогреть, немного смазать маслом. В середину налить тесто, сковороду покрутить, чтобы тесто равномерно распределилось. Когда низ блина зазолотится, его надо перевернуть.
6. Жарить со второй стороны буквально несколько секунд. Затем блин снять со сковороды.

Не ешьте говно, кушайте вкусные домашние блинчики!

[h1]One must imagine Overwatch players being happy[/h1]
Best release on Steam all the In-App purchases are a scam doesn't even give you the items.

The game is fun if you want a class based hero shooter like TF2 that actually gets meaningful updates more than once every four years.
New heroes are initially locked behind the battle pass, but you can get them for free by doing challenges. (though some new heroes are given to everyone for free; the newest hero as of August 10 2023, Illari, is completely free for everyone.)

The community, like many competitive FPSes, is full of toxicity, but thankfully voice chat can be muted and you can ignore most of this.

As for monitization practices, OW1 utilized a controversial lootbox system that has been denounced as gambling for children. Due to increased international legal pressure (for instance, belgum essentially bans games with lootboxes now), OW2 ditches this system in favor of one of the most FOMO-fueled battle passes i've seen.

All skins are now locked behind the battle pass, and there's barely any noteworthy free times to get from it; you have to buy premium to get anything and hope you can finish it on time or else it's gone and  you have to hope they'll repackage any skins you missed in a bundle for $15. Unlike the heroes, there's no way to grind to get skins for free; every skin you have to shell money out for, unlike OW1, which was shockingly generous with its free lootboxes.

The PvE update also feels like a slap in the face, too. PvE for the longest was promoted as the next big thing for Overwatch; a new experience that would form a new pillar for the game. After lengthy, troubled development and tons of scandal within Blizzard, they finally give us a heavily scaled back version of what they originally planned.... and you can't even play it unless you sign up for ANOTHER premium purchase alongside the battle pass, but don't worry, they still have one small event mission to play that's basically just a glorified version of the limited Uprising events they did in OW1. 

Honestly, I was more than willing to give OW2 a good review, but the way they handled PvE pushed any good will I had for this game into the trash. If you have friends that play it, do play it with them, it really is fun, but don't get suckered into their moneymaking schemes; it's clear ActiBlizz only cares about your money rather than giving OW fans the best experience possible.

The December game trailer revealed that Overwatch 2 is transitioning to a Free-to-Play model. However, accessing new content in Overwatch 2 now requires a payment. Despite employing a similar technique as other games available on Steam for revival, this approach might not yield the desired results. As a result, I cannot recommend the game.
